New Records: South Africa have broken the record for most sixes hit in a single edition of the World Cup
Quinton de Kock alone has hit 4 centuries in the tournament, equaling the record of Rohit Sharma and Kumar Sangakkara for most hundreds in a single edition of the tournament
Key Match Events: Quinton de Kock's 103-ball century laid the stone for South Africa to notch up yet another 300+ total while batting first in the World Cup 2023
Rassies van der Dussen also brought up his second century in the tournament, hitting his century off 101 balls
Miscellaneous Highlights: South Africa finished their innings with 357 runs for the loss of 4 wickets - their fourth 350+ total in the tournament
